medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea and vomiting, with weakness and poor appetite.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Nausea started the evening before admission, resulting in vomiting throughout the night. The patient has had decreased urination and experienced some right-sided soreness after vomiting. There are no reported fevers, chills, or dark/bloody bowel movements.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, prostate cancer treated with radiation, bradycardia (s/p pacemaker), recurrent urinary tract infections, hiatal hernia, aortic aneurysm, intermittent diplopia (s/p prisms), peripheral neuropathy with gait disturbance, hypothyroidism, bilateral knee replacements, vertebral fusion.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of early myocardial infarction, arrhythmia, cardiomyopathies, or sudden cardiac death; otherwise non-contributory.
